titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Symfoni No 5 / for / Orkester / af / Carl Nielsen. / op 50

notesStmt.annot: Library binding. The score was used as a conducting score by CN and presumably also by other conductors, which is reflected in corrections and additions in the score.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Cover: Carl Nielsen / Symfoni nr /2den Del Title page (library addition): [Carl Nielsen : Symfoni nr. 5 Op. 50]

notesStmt.annot: The cover originally only contained the second movement. Later, the first movement has been added. Added on back cover in CN's hand: "De [crossed out]Dunkle, hvilende Kræfter / De [crossed out] Vaagne Kræfter" (Dark resting forces / awakened forces).

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Added in unknown hand: Carl Nielsen. 5te symfoni (Adagio)

notesStmt.annot: Sketch for the 16 bar Adagio theme, first movement bb.268-283.
Three sketches for the first movement, contained in the autograph of piano suite opus 45; manuscript dated "Damgaard 20 August 19" and "Damgaard August 19".
Rhythmic reworking of two bars of the Adagio theme of the fist movement, contained in manuscript with music for the play Moderen.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Printed title label: UNVERKÄUFLICHES LEIHMATERIAL :: EIGENTHUM DES VERLEGERS / CARL NIELSEN / SYMPHONIE NR. 5 OP. 50 / [...] / SKANDINAVISK OG BORUPS MUSIKFORLAG / AKTIESELSKAB / BREDGADE 31 KØBENHAVN K

notesStmt.annot: Set of parts, some of which were used for the first edition and later, in 1926, as printing copies for the publication by Borups Musikforlag. In 1933 further copies were added to the set.The set was used as rental material until 1951, when it was given to The Royal Library.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Carl Nielsen. / SYMFONI No 5. / Op. 50 / Partitur. / Borups Musikforlag / Palægade 2. København. K. / -1926- / Tous droits réservés. Dedication on leaf after title page: Til mine Venner / VERA og CARL JOHAN MICHAELSEN

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: Front page: CARL NIELSEN / SYMFONI no. 5 / PARTITUR / SKANDINAVISK MUSIKFORLAG / KØBENHAVN / III. Title page: Til mine venner / Vera og Carl Michaelsen / CARL NIELSEN / SYMFONI no. V / OP. 50 / PARTITUR / SKANDINAVISK MUSIKFORLAG / KØBENHAVN

notesStmt.annot: First printed edition, containing a preface by Emil Telmaányi and Erik Tuxen dated August 1950.

titlePage.label: Title page
titlePage.p: CARL NIELSEN / SYMFONI no. 5 / SYMPHONY no. V / OP. 50 / PARTITUR / FULL SCORE / SKANDINAVISK MUSIKFORLAG / KØBENHAVN / III

notesStmt.annot: Preface by Erik Tuxen dated August 1950. Including six pages of editorial notes.

history.p: Nielsen began working on the symphony in the autumn of 1922, concurrently with the composition of incidental music for Helge Rode’s play The Mother, and the fair copy of the symphony was end-dated 15 January 1922. He had had to put aside the symphony during the summer of 1921 in order to finish the vocal work Springtime on Funen, which had been under way for a long time.

event.corpName: Orchestre de la Société des Concerts du Conservatoire

expression.tempo: Allegro. Presto. Andante tranquillo. Allegro (Tempo I)
